issue.title: [Python] Write serialized object as a stream of encapsulated IPC messages
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-1509](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1509). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
The structure of the stream in `arrow::py::WriteSerializedObject` is generated on an ad hoc basis – the components of the stream would be easier to manipulate if this were internally a generic stream of IPC messages. For example, one would be able to examine only the union that represents the structure of the serialized payload and leave the tensors undisturbed

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1509?focusedCommentId=16932583) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Not sure we still want to enhance the Python object serialization layer.
